    ---
    title: "K-Fold Cross Validation"
    categories: [validation]
    ---

    <div class="topic-meta">Updated: {{< meta date format='YYYY-MM-DD' >}}</div>


**Definition.** Repeat model training and hold-out evaluation **K** times on different folds; report mean performance and variability.

**Guidelines.**
- Shuffle within constraints; for time series use **blocked** or **rolling** CV.
- Tune hyperparameters within inner folds (nested CV) to avoid optimism.
- Report distribution (mean Â± sd) and a final refit on full training data.

**When not to use standard K-fold.**
- Strong temporal dependence (use walk-forward).
- Grouped observations requiring **grouped** CV.
